name: The Roosevelt Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights with a large group in town for a food and wine event. Our room was labeled deluxe and was marginal at best. Small, with a stained and noisy air-conditioner, stained carpeting, questionable bedding, a loose bed frame that almost catapulted my husband to the wall, torn lampshades and a tiny, uncomfortable bathroom with a very hard to work shower control.
reviews.title: Nothing to offer but location!

reviews.text: I talked with two others in our group whose rooms were so bad (roaches in one, and no electricity in the other!) that they changed hotels.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel I've Stayed in in NYC
Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff
reviews.text: Sunday morning was impossible -- 15-20 minute waits for the elevator, with very long lines at the bell desk and front desk. Too bad this hotel has never had a lot of people scheduled to check out at one time before, so they would know how to staff accordingly!!!
I took my staff up to NYC for a show as part of a business trip and we booked 3 rooms for 2 nights.
reviews.title: An oldie, but a goodie

reviews.text: When I first visited their website I thought we had made a great selection considering the location and the pictures of the hotel - don't be fooled!
reviews.title: Great for the price. Central to everything.

reviews.text: I went to the Roosevelt (booked by my employer) with very low expectations based on other members' reviews.
reviews.title: Could have been much worse

reviews.text: Location was excellent - close to theatres and shopping, but off the main streets (no car horns at 6am.)
reviews.title: It could have been worse

reviews.text: Yes, the room was very small - it's an old hotel so I wasn't that surprised. Big by European standards.
reviews.title: Easy and cosy

reviews.text: Bathroom was average-sized and clean.
reviews.title: Grand Lobby - Shame about the Room

likes.disliked: — Size of room and state of bathroom

reviews.title: be careful! .... these people took my money!
reviews.text: The mattress was brand new (and very comfy), however there was no quilt/comforter. They gave me 2 extra blankets instead. Maybe a little tacky, but not the end of the world.

Although the entrance and lobby pay tribute to it's historic attributes, don't be fooled. The Roosevelt Hotel does not quite measure up to industry standards. I will recognize the bell staff and bar waiter for their attentive service - but it stops there. One of my colleagues rooms was not ready until 7:30pm in the evening and was told there was 'no place to change clothes'
reviews.title: While the hotel has made some improvements, I would not stay here

reviews.text: I was originally checked into an accessible room - with no fixed shower head. I asked to move but was told I'd have to wait another day even though there were plenty of rooms ready when I first arrived. I also had to re-pack all my belongings and store with the bell stand yet again - frustrating when you are in town for business. I was not alerted that I even had this room type to begin with. The pillows in the rooms have pointed ends on all fours - I woke up one morning with a large scratch down the side of my face. It was red and cut up enough for my colleagues to notice the next morning. Although food in New York is expensive, $30 for oatmeal and coffee seemed extreme.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maids do not knock before entering a room and they are quick to enter between 8am-8:30am so make sure you have your deadbolt locked. I also had trouble understanding the English from some of the employees- including two bell man.
reviews.title: Do not be fooled by the beautiful lobby, the rooms are awfull and overpriced. Avoid unless desperate.

reviews.text: Elevators- it is impossible to get one to not stop at every floor. It seems every time you need to go to your room, they are always busy. Though this is trivial, it became rather annoying being in the 14th floor and having 5 stops or more every time I had to use one.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.text: Lastly when I was packing up the day before I left, I noticed a small 'pebble dropping' on the bed comforter. Not sure where that came from, but I'd rather not know. From what I've heard, this hotel had improved quite a bit from where it was last year, but by no means does it even compare to staying at an average Holiday Inn. Rooms were advertised at $299 per night, but I honestly I wouldn't hesitate spending the extra $30-$50 per night to get a much higher level of accommodation and service. You will thank yourself later.
reviews.title: Charm and location, but expect problems with the room

reviews.text: For a bid of $180 per night, Priceline put me at the Roosevelt for a 6-night business trip. And for that price, it was just fine, but there's no way I would pay the rack rate of $300+ per night to stay here. There was nothing horrible about it, and there was plenty that was good. My room was huge, with 2 queen beds and a huge walk-in closet. It was by far the biggest hotel room I have ever had in Manhattan. The employees were friendly and helpful. The location was good, just a few feet from Grand Central and an easy walk to Times Square, 5th Ave, etc.
reviews.title: Okay if you get a great deal on the rate...

reviews.text: But the place felt dated and creaky. The elevators were slow. The room air conditioning system made a lot of noise but not much cool air. The toilet flushed reluctantly and the shower drain was also cranky. One morning I took a shower and the water was warm, but would not get hot.
reviews.title: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone

reviews.text: And they charge $15 a day for wireless internet which I think is outright gouging.
reviews.title: Great customer service

reviews.text: I would stay here again as long as I was paying under $200 a night, but not more than that.
reviews.title: Can't Beat This Location

reviews.text: My family and I recently stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel on a recent trip to NYC. I have stayed at several other 3 1/2 and 4 star hotels in Manhattan and I have never had such a bad experience. Upon check in we went to our room (which was a requested non-smoking room) and the room smelled of smoke. Not just a faint smell but an intense cloud of cigarette smoke. We complained to the front desk and or room was moved. Our new room had a problem with the hot water heater and even after maintenance "fixed" the problem we only got a hot shower one out of the three nights we stayed there. During our second night, my sister discovered a crusty yellow stain on the bed sheets.
reviews.title: Nothing Fancy, But Great Location

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel in Dec 09. One of the main reasons I picked this hotel was because they had safes in the room. On the 2nd day of our stay our money was stolen from this safe. This was a terryifying experiience and completely changed the enjoyment of the holiday. I was told at the time that I would have to claim this back from the hotel's insurance company but I have just been advised by the insurance company that the hotel is not liable for the loss of my money. I have since read another review from a person who had their money stolen as well. I would like to warn other travellers that might be thinking of staying in this hotel that their money is not safe or insured by putting it into the safe in the room.
reviews.title: Money stolen and I'm not the first

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading mixed reviews we thought the Roosevelt would be the perfect hotel for our first visit to New York. When walking into the hotel we thought we had made a great decision as the lobby looks incredible and the doormen were very helpful. We had asked for early check in but this couldn't be accommodated so we were upgraded to a king size room which turned out to be a blessing!
reviews.title: Tired and disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we could finally check in, we were happy with the size of the room, but that's where it stopped. The bathroom didn't look like it had been updated in 30 years and the bath was dirty. The carpet in the room hadn't been hoovered properly and the wardrobe was tiny. We didn't experience any noise from pipes like other reviewers, however our view out of the hotel window was non descript. After a couple of other problems, we found the reception staff to be very rude, and there seemed to be a constant stream of varying complaints from other visitors.
reviews.title: excellent hotel had a brilliant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we wouldn't recommend this to anyone drawn in by the pictures on the hotel website - the entrance is impressive but everything else is a bit of a let down.
reviews.title: Very disappointing.... could do so much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was worried about staying here after reading bad reviews. All the staff we spoke to were really friendly, our room was a lovely size nice and clean the bed was huge. The maid cleaned every day she was very friendly too. We had an excellent week here theres only one thing i would change and thats put a kettle in the rooms.
reviews.title: Not Impressed
Don't know what they're moaning about??
reviews.text: Great location just off Madison Avenue. Fantastic lobby as shown on hotel photos. Nice spacious bar area too that has a Starbucks station

reviews.title: The Big Apple!
reviews.text: in the mornings. Reception was prompt and friendly. We booked through

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Expedia and had no problems but upon checking in a couple were turned
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel, a wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: away as the hotel didn't have record of their booking - said Expedia had not passed it on. I always call ahead to confirm now just to make
reviews.title: Great hotel - really helpful staff

reviews.text: sure.
reviews.title: Not pleasant

reviews.text: Myself and two friends stayed at The Roosevelt for two nights on a whirl wind weekend trip to New York City. From the very beginning this hotel is stunning. The entrance and lobby takes you back in time as it gives the feeling of a grand ballroom. Marble floors, wrought iron 2nd floor balconies and painted ceilings including a piano on the 2nd level overlooking the entrance. We were greated right away and the front desk staff were nothing but friendly (despite previous reviews I had read). Our bags were checked as we arrived very early and headed out on the town. Upon our return our bags were promptly brought to our room. We were on the 17th floor at the very end of the hallway in an actual cornor room. The room is average size, the bathroom was clean but very small (could have been due to the end of the hall location). The tolietries were Bath and Body Works, which couldn't have thrilled us girls more!!
reviews.title: Excellent experience-I highly recommend this classy hotel!

reviews.text: Now let me emphasize what has been said before about the beds.....they are truly the most comfortable beds we had ever slept in. They beat the Sheraton Sleeper beds hands down!! We never heard any hallway noise or slamming doors and the couple of times we called down for assistance we were taken care of promptly.
reviews.title: Amazing!

likes.liked: — The location and how close it was to Times Square
likes.disliked: — Nothing that I can think of

reviews.title: a little worn, average service, but nice overall
reviews.text: One of the best parts of this hotel is truly the LOCATION!!!! We timed it and on a normal walk it was 6 minutes to Times Square, you literally walk out the front door and turn right and Times Square is straight ahead. We felt safe at all times of the day and could get anywhere we wanted by walking. We ate breakfast both mornings on the same street as the hotel (45th). There are a number of morning deli's and cafes that serve fresh and prepared meals at really reasonable prices...I think one was called the Nineteenth Street Market? Anyway, I will be returning to NYC with my husband someday and would not hesitate to return to The Roosevelt.
My travel agent suggested this hotel and at first I was conearned due to the reviews on this page. I went for it anyways as the price was great.
reviews.title: Great Value Coupled with Superb Location

reviews.text: This hotel was GREAT! I cannot complain about anything! The staff was great and extremely helpful! We booked our broadway tickets with our hotel and the concierge helped us out with where to go in the evening. He even called ahead for us and got us on the list so we would be guaranteed entrance. The location is also great!
reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable

likes.liked: — The bed, the service and a good feel about the hotel
likes.disliked: — The bath could have been abit deeper

reviews.text: we paid $330/night for 2 nights. this was cheaper than any of the travel sites. talked to a lady in the lobby and she had paid $475 for similar room, we laughed, must be like a cruise, everyone pays a different price. husband and i decided, before we went, that the price was so great and location perfect, we would not complain except filth/critters!! didn't expect much, according to some of the reviews. But---our experience was good, very good. we got there early, the desk clerk apologized a room wasn't ready, but said she would get one as soon as possible. she did just that and we we got in at 1, check in is at 3. she asked if we wanted bell service for luggage but explained that so many prefer to take their own now with easily wheeled lugg.(for the person on this site who thought that was strange, i thought it was extremely well-handled, considering that these poor bellman have had their tip money really decreased) our room was huuuuge. king bed, big desk, beautiful couch with throw pillows. bath ok. very clean and nice carpeting. view was of some kind of equipment, that was very ugly. that was ok with us, 'cause the room was so great, just kept the drapes drawn. requested more hangers and they were brought immediately. iron/board and a great room safe. my husband attended a seminar here and he said the room and food was wonderful. at check-out we requested another hour and got it without a problem. we had about 6 hours before our flight and about our afternoon walking we came back and sat in the lobby reading. lots and lots of chairs/couches in lobby and upstairs mezzanine overlooking lobby. got our luggage they had stored. doormen extremely helpful with finding us a cab that took credit cards. will definitely return. i've paid 450 to 550$ lately, so this was a terrific bargain. if i got a smaller room that would still be ok. lots of good, the bad was the visit was too brief, the ugly was the view!!
reviews.title: the good, bad and ugly

likes.disliked: — view, if this is important to you, ask

reviews.text: A stay at such a swank hotel should have been an awesome experience. Maybe it is all of New York (flash the cash) impressing man is not my idea of having fun.
reviews.title: Just a Peasant

reviews.text: "overly priced from room to lounge drinks" Courtesy and Kindness is so much better, I didn't ask hotel to arrange for my transportation to L.G.A so why would they ask to help with my bags when private owned agency came and didn't help either? Sad experience but a whole lot wiser!!
reviews.title: Expect the Older Hotel feel

reviews.text: This Hotel is too big to get the personal touch feel. Like most older hotels, the rooms are small along with the bathrooms. They try to make it look good by sprucing up the beds. Rooms were average in the clean area. It is priced fair for the expectations. I was here for a week conference. My history is staying at nice hotels such as the Four Seasons so I know nice hotels. Some foreigners might say good things but if you stayed in Europe, you will understand their taste.
reviews.title: Total enjoyed the Roosevelt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Roosevelt in October and had a great time. The hotel is at a great location. Just around the corner from shopping on 5th Ave and a few blocks from Times Square and yet just the right distance away from all the hoopla at Times Square. The staff was courteous and very helpful. Very helpful! If I need directions anywhere they were in the know. Our waiter at the Roosevelt Grill was so nice and very interesting to speak to. They were great. Rooms were small but we weren't in them very long. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Great Hotel...Great Location

likes.disliked: — internet access in business center was by credit card charge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walked into impressive lobby and got checked in. Upgraded to a standard double which was an adequate size (cosy queen must be tiny!). Room is dated and in need of refurbishment. Bit smelly, but clean and tidy except for the odd exposed wire connecting the lamp into the wall and the bathroom door not closing properly. The air conditioning unit kept us awake for much of the first night. Tried switching it off and opening the window - but street noise was just as bad. Next morning requested that the air con unit was fixed. Had to complain again when we returned to the hotel later that afternoon as still not repaired. Engineer came up and replaced the unit within the hour. On last day checked out with no problem. Asked a member of staff if the hotel would look after the bags whilst we enjoyed our last day, he then proceeded to make 2 phone calls before passing us onto a colleague - rude. On returning to the hotel to collect the bags the doorman found one, but then I had to go into the room to find the other 2 as they had not been stowed together. All in all the hotel was not worth the money we paid. We have previously stayed at Club Quarters at The Rockafeller Center which put The Roosevelt to shame and was a fraction of the cost. Don't be fooled by the impressive pictures on the website - this needs to be refurbished!
reviews.title: More cons than pros

reviews.text: Lobby is very nice, front desk & staff not very friendly, but OK. Room is little small for a cozy double, double, OK bath. Grand central terminal right across the street, Time Square, Rockectfeller, United Nations withing walking distance. If you need breakfast go to "Pizza shop" at 5th Ave, then turn left, pretty good. NY always a nice place to visit this is our 3rd time in the city & we still have a lot of places to go for next trip.
reviews.title: Nice location, average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On weekend door to Grand central is closed so you need to enter from Park Ave next to Michael Jordan Steak House.
reviews.title: great location
The Roosevelt - Manhattan,New York
reviews.text: we recently stayed at the Roosevelt at 45 th and Madison . The location is great . Very close to Grand Central ,and Times Square . The rooms very large for N. Y . We had 2 queen beds. . with lots of room . The bathroom could use some freshing . The wall paper needs fixing The fitness room on the 2nd floor is open 24/7 , and free of charge .The staff were very friendly, and helpful. We took the bus to LGA for only $12.00. each .This sure beats a cab.

Grand foyer....fit for royalty! Amazing location, pretty close to grand central station, time square, nbc and 5th avenue. Concierge and staff were friendly without being "in your face". My only gripe: room was a little cramped.
reviews.title: Beware - do not go there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: fantastic location - the hotel is one block from Madison Avenue, two blocks from mid 5th Avenue and 15 minutes walk from Times Square. The rooms are not the biggest but the beds are!!!. everything is clean and in good condition with a safe in the room. Everyone is friendly and Starbucks operates from the bar every morning. The foyer is a tourist location in itself with it's traditional features. Price - cheap compared to other hotels in the same location and we found it well worth the money and would stay again
reviews.title: fantastic location

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel from May 18-21/07. It was absolutely perfect!
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.text: We had booked through Expedia and when we checked in we were given an upgrade from the Petite Room with a Queen bed to a King Sized bed with a slightly larger room. The beds were very comfortable, the room was clean. I would agree that the bathrooms are so-so, but really, for a couple of days it did the trick. The bathroom had a hairdryer and bath and body works products.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.text: The location was very convenient! The concierge pointed out Grand Central Terminal for us and the subway made things very accessible. We did not think that we would take the subway, but it saved us a ton of money in cab rides. We took the subway to Century 21, SOHO and to Central Park (72nd Street) and we didn't have any problems. The hotel is very close to all of the shops on fifth avenue, bloomingdales, macy's and times square.
reviews.title: loved it will come again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an awesome time and couldn't have asked for more, particularly since the hotel offers a great price.
reviews.title: Great Value!! Nice and Clean

reviews.text: We just returned home (Dec. 2-6, 2006) from NYC and our "alternative:" Hotel Roosevelt. This is the hotel which The Hotel Mela booked for us for the same rate (averaged at $469 a night for 4 nights including fees and taxes) they had quoted. when their hotel was further delayed to open.......
reviews.title: Beautiful old hotel with great character in lobby, helpful staff!

likes.disliked: — black mold around white caulking of bathtub- housecleaning needs to use bleach to remove this! No mini bar, no comforters on beds, tv too small, no cd/clock radio, little space around sink...

reviews.text: This accomodation was actually far better than the bad reviews on this forum...
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: With the "deluxe" room #704/versus a "smaller superior room" (around the corner from the elevator, but quiet except for outside street "trash pickups") ....the s.f. space, comfortable king bed/linens, plenty of closet and drawer space (3 plus nightstands), desk/chair, safe were great! There was some mildew around the bathtub caulking and no counter space on the traditional sink, but a glass shelf over the commode. The tv was really small as reported , no mini bar and although there were 3 table lamps, the window is small and lets in very little natural light.... And as reported no comforters, but housekeeping quickly accomodated us with 2 additional king "vellux" blankets of which they made up the bed the next day with 2 of the blankets! They also responded quickly to additiional bath towels, a flower vase and 2 champagne glasses! All in all, the staff could not have been more helpful or nicer. I do not know why other guests complained so about the service at this hotel. And if you want a nice, architectural lobby especially with Xmas decorations- it was great! And what a busy bar off the lobby!
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.text: We arrived at the Rooservelt at 1pm on the 18th Nov 2006(6 of us) the rooms were not ready. Told to come back at 2pm still not ready. We were given a voucher to have a drink on them and we did (best glass of wine I've had in a long time). 2.30pm rooms ready one couple are smokers and were given a smoking room on the 18th floor lovely large room two windows (to get rid of the smoke I guess) and great views out of the windows. 2nd Couple had a room on 17th floor this consisted of a sitting room and a bed room 2TV's 2A/C units 2 windows. Only complaint with this room was a little hot and you could hear a little building work outside.otherwise excellent. Our room was on the 7th Floor and was slightly smaller than the other two but again a very comfortable room one window. No complaints at all.
reviews.title: Big room, good service and great location

likes.liked: — Central location, large room, comfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Roosevelt is in an absolutly great spot for most of the sites and if we return to New York we will stay here again. All 6 of us would recommend this Hotel. Our rooms were the next upgrade from their basic room and would recommend you pay that little bit extra. 6Tripadvisers from Cheltenham England. Don't forget to book on line with the Hotel (Airlinenetwork were going to charge us £200 per couple more)
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Try and get a room without an adjoining door to next room

reviews.text: Do Not Waste Your money!!! (there's a reason why this hotel has good deals!!!)
reviews.title: GROSS!!!

reviews.text: The rooms are filthy (dirty towels, stained comforters, carpet, etc.)
reviews.title: dont stay here!!!!

reviews.text: The hotel and rooms NEED to be updated (the first room we were assigned had a leg missing to the bed!)
reviews.title: Looks can be deceiving!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Management is not helpful! (We were so grossed out so we decided to cancel our three nights at the Roosevelt and booked a room at a different hotel. The management knew our complaints and agreed, however, they still demanded that we pay for 1 night. We finally agreed to a $50 fee as they said they needed to send a cleaning crew to the room since we were in there. We AGREED that they needed to clean it up because no one would accept that room as is!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: When my sister returned home from our three day trip in NYC, the Roosevelt charged THREE NIGHTS on her credit card. She called and they said there wasn't a manager on duty who could assist her and she would need to call back later. SERIOUSLY??
reviews.title: DUMP, Save Your Money!

reviews.text: A real mixed bag of a hotel. Some really good and nice things and some awful .
reviews.title: Expensive for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is very nce and looks well. Having had to change hotel at short notice as my flight back was cancelled and booked more or less blind on hotels.com it was a relief to walk into the lobby and feel comfortable (good) . Then I walked into the room - it stank (bad) . Apart from a very odd question about what had we done in the room there was no problem switching to a different and even a little nicer room - it seemed a little larger (good) . Although generally speaking the rooms were small and could do with refurb. (not so good) . In the move I left my credit card in the old room and didn't notice until the hotel reception called me during the evening to say they had it and were holding it for me (excellent ) as in the wrong hands it could have gone anywhere.
reviews.title: A Very xmasy hotel... but tad noisy at night

reviews.text: The bell hops and the doormen outside arehustlers pure and simple. I have stayed in four different hotels in NYC over the last few years and the hustling by these guys was off the scale compared to the others. Money for everything. One bellhop told me that as the hotel didn't charge for storing bags so I should pay him. He got a small amount to put the bags in and then some other guy wanted more to take them out. Forget it. The doorman outside asked if I wanted a taxi or a limo parked nearby to take us to JFK. I said taxi but he called up his mate in the limo anyway. We stopped for petrol on the way out whcih was unprecented as it was his local petrol station and we drove ten to fifteen minutes off the highway to get to it. it was an agreed flat fare of $55 inc tax and tip and I wasn't paying a cent over the agreed number. All in all the hustle and the feeling of being incessantky ripped off means I wouldn't go back to this one but I do have to say that the credit card incident reflects really well on the staff involved.
reviews.title: Watch out for room theft!

reviews.text: We was upgraded to this hotel, after we booked the milford plaza but it closed for refubishment we was over moon as we tried to book here to start with but too much money, and we didnt have pay any extra thanks to expedia :).
reviews.title: Right in Midtown, can't beat it!
GREAT STAY
reviews.text: we arrived 18th december on entrance the xmas tree is amazing the whole lobby area is very cosy, bell boys bit annoying straight away trying to take your bags and asking for tips. we was an hour early to check in so we walked down to bloomigdales brought my ugg boots then checked in. a great start to the shopping trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I, too, reserved my room at the Roosevelt with a promotional deal for $139 per night for a deluxe king room. I thought it was a great deal at that price! My room was on the small side, but very clean and very comfortable. The bed was awesome! The room and hotel were not in top shape and there were some minor issues (slightly peeling wallpaper, stained carpets in the hallways etc.). But, the location was fantastic and my experience was good. I found the staff to be generally helpful and courteous. But, I did receive several pieces of incorrect information from the concierge (concerning transportation options to the airport).
reviews.title: Nice for the cost and location!

reviews.text: At first, i got a room without a window. After complaining i got a room with a view to a wall. The room smelled from an dirty air conditioning, it was noisy also. Other than that, cleaniness was OK. Has everything that is in standard for a 3-star hotel but was noticeably of lower quality than other 3-stars i have been to, unless someone likes everything to look like it's 50 years old. The ad says it's renovated but it appears that it's just the lobby that has been renovated and not recently. The service was uninterested with me. Breakfast was expensive for the value.
reviews.title: Poor - more like 2 stars. Dodgy fees on the receipt.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are some strange entries on my receipt - what is Javis Centre Fee? I haven't used anything like this, and the actual Javis Centre is not even close to this hotel. Just 2x $1.50 makes it not worth of calling to rectify.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean - recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just returned from a week staying here on a package deal booked through Virgin, it's strange how so many reviews differ! We had a great week staying at the Roosevelt (in early May). Our room was comfortable and very clean. Whenever we needed to speak to the staff for directions or anything, they were helpful and polite to us. We had a drink at the mad46 bar up on the 19th floor, which was a little costly - but offered wonderful views. Well situated and with good facilities, I'd say this place was a winner.
reviews.title: Dont take notice of other reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a 7 night stay at The Roosevelt Hotel in New York. I must admit that I was nervous about staying there due to the reviews I had read. I really don't know what people expect from hotels. Our room was small but it was fine, after all you only sleep there. The bedding and towels were changed every day as were any toiletries which needed replenishing. The location was good. When we arrived our room wasn't ready but the friendly receptionist said she would have a room ready within ½ hour. We requested non smoking and away from the elevators. Within the timescale or room was ready. We didn't mind waiting. The doormen and the cleaning ladies were all very friendly and all to happy to help. We had trouble using the safe and asked at reception for further instructions. Within no time at all Al the Security man arrived and explained how it worked also asked if we needed any help with anything else and if the room was ok - which it was. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are so many restaurants to choose from elsewhere. We had taken a travel kettle with us as we had read that there were no coffee facilities in the room. That is the only thing that would have been nice - but we came prepared so all was well. In short don't worry if you have booked to stay here as it was fine.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.text: One couldn't really expect more from a USD $210/night hotel in midtown Manhattan. The location is obviously excellent for most intents and purposes, and staff is generally friendly and helpful. Don't come here expecting Peninsula-level service, but Roosevelt is definitely a strong contender for a centrally located hotel in NYC.
reviews.title: Excellent location and decently priced. Don't come here expecting pampering though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: well placed for everything,safe clean and easy going,staff were helpful,with reccomendations on diners etc try the comfort diner for breakfast out of the door turn left keep going straight on ,good food,big portions friendly staff.hotel always friendly and willingto do whateveres neede we had a leaky loo and it was sorted straight away.
reviews.title: clean friendly well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i would go back tommorrow and may do this christmas,having done other new york hotels th rooms are all small unless you pay big bucks so these are ok give it a go you will love it
reviews.title: Great location but needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a fairly good deal on this hotel on priceline. Great location as its centered in midtown yet is far enough away from times square and all the tourist nonsense. It was one of the smallest rooms we ever had in the city. Nice comfortable bed, but hardly room to move around. The rug was worn thru near the bathroom and the dresser was quite banged up. Bathroom was clean. Wonderful old style lobby and every staff member we met was pleasent. All in all not a bad place if you get a good price. As example, if we had paid regular price for this room, i could have had a much better one at the Waldorf instead for only $40 more or Hilton for only $20 more! At only $90 plus tx it was worth it.
reviews.title: Great location - lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't understand all the negative comments on here about this hotel. I guess it's that thing where most people who have a good time on holidays don't think to put a review in but those who have a bad time are quick to write a bad review.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Roosevelt. You can't beat the location, it's close to Times Square.The room was a decent size for NY and the beds were very comfortable. However, the shower was broken: it would give you only scolding or freezing water and they never repaired it. The safe was broken and they wouldn't fix it if we weren't in the room. The wake-up call never came: they had problems with the phones (good thing we didn't have a plane to catch). Although the location is great, the service is inadequate to keep this hotel running smoothly.
reviews.title: Too bad the service sucks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location but the rooms were just okay. We had booked a smoking room which wasn't available at check in. We were told we could smoke on the smoking floor but when we did the hotel staff freaked out. No coffee maker in the room and couldn't get a coffee in the morning; we had to go outside to a pushcart coffee vendor. No decent place to smoke outside. no place to sit and you have to suffer the dirty looks of people coming through the front door. We had asked for extra hangers which never showed up. Staff didn't really seem to care at all. Towels were are hung inside shower so they have to be moved to prevent them from getting soaked. Generally poor attitude overall like they were doing you a favour letting you stay there. Overall poor value for the money and wouldn't stay there again.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: While the lobby makes you think of its more splendid past, the rooms are slightly disappointing and overdue for a more comprehensive overhaul. Still, everything works and the hotel is clean. While not really enjoyable, the gym is doing its job. Meanwhile, the staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is clearly good value for money and the ideal location for the business traveller and for those combining business with leisure.
reviews.title: Location matters

reviews.text: a snowstorm caused mass flight cancellations, so I had to request another night's stay. I was told very rudely that there was no space in the hotel. I explained my situation, that my flight had been canceled and I just needed any room for the night. Again he was very rude and stated that that was not the hotel's responsibility. Finally, I was fed up and asked if he would throw me out into the snow, to which he stated, "that is not our responsibility."
reviews.title: manager was incredibly rude, bathroom stank of cigarettes.

reviews.text: also, the bathroom stank of cigarettes but that seems incredibly minor after the manager's attitude.
reviews.title: Conflicted- but disappointed

reviews.text: My wife and i booked this hotel through British Airways and arrived on the 1st September 2006.We arrived minus our luggage and after explaining this to the check in staff a large bag of toiletries were delivered to our room,not a bad start.
reviews.title: Not a great hotel but not a bad one either.Firefigher from Belfast

reviews.text: We had read reviews after booking and were slightly concerned however whilst the room was on the small side it was clean and adequte for our needs and yes there can be problems with the lifts being slow.The restaurant was over priced and the food was average, drinks in the bar were also expensive.
reviews.title: One star would be a gift

reviews.text: The location itself was perfect,5minutes walk to 5th ave and the shopping,in fact we only took 3 taxis in the 5 days we stayed in NY.
reviews.title: A Shambles

reviews.text: The staff were all very pleasent and helpful,so other than the 3 day delay for our luggage a very nice holiday.
reviews.title: On business but felt like a dorm room visit

likes.disliked: — The Room and the Bell Staff

reviews.title: Watch it 'priceline' users !!!!!!
reviews.text: I stayed here as I was attending some meetings here on Sept. 16, 2006. Checked in around 1:30 a.m. and after getting my key was asked by the bellman whether I wanted him to take my bag to the room. Interesting since it is on wheels and he didn't offer to help me lug it up the stairs from the street 10 minutes earlier. The room was so small that to walk between the bed and the TV I had to turn sideways. Since I was checking out in the morning and it was late I didn't change rooms. Had I been staying more then a night I would have. The bathroom was gross and the door to it didn't close. The air conditioning was good but loud. With the UN in session the place was crawling with security both inside and out. I wouldn't give this hotel consideration at any price. There are absolutely better choices out there.

reviews.title: Hotel is OK but got double charged for stay
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in March because of fairly good reviews on this site and also because there was a very good deal through expedia.

reviews.title: A perfect New York hotel...
reviews.text: I was somewhat disappointed - when we got there, I noticed a small milk carton that had been left there by the previous guests. Also, the phone had dried jam on it as did the window sill. The bathroom was cleaned every day but the floor was never cleaned thoroughly.

reviews.title: Lovley Hotel In Fantastic Lacation
reviews.text: Don't get me wrong - it wasn't a horrible experience but I had expected better. I'd say the same about the service - it was fine but I never felt people went out of their way for the customer.

reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
reviews.text: The room was on the small side and noisy but hey, this is New York!

reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location
reviews.text: The real clincher was that we checked out with a $0 balance since we had booked months before through expedia. Next thing we know, a $1500 charge was put on our Visa card!! After a few phone calls, they did reimburse the charge but of course, we ended up losing $200 CDN on the exchange, being a Canadian Visa card. Now we have to deal with Visa, blah blah!! And it was all because of the hotel. So watch out!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights over the Christmas holiday. Lobby is very impressive with a really nice bar, the bar food was also very good and worth the extra few $$. We had a superior king room which was a great size with a massive and very comfortable bed! Bathroom was small but adequate if a little shabby but clean. Lots of space to put clothes and shopping away in. One downside was that the room got very hot at night but it wasnt noisy with the window open.
reviews.title: Brilliant Location! Really Nice Hotel!! Couldnt have been happier!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is just brilliant, right next to Grand Central where our favourite restaurant was (Micheal Jordan's) and only a few blokes to time square and all major attractions.
reviews.title: excellent hotel,great location,fab value for money,esp nice at christmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the decor was a little dated and a bit shabby round the edges but we really enjoyed our stay and would def go back.
reviews.title: Ideal for a first time visit to New York

reviews.text: We got our rate through expedia which was probably cheaper than the rack rate and was worth every penny.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didnt have many dealings with staff as we didnt have to complain about anything, but when we did they were very friendly.
reviews.title: Your paying for the lobby!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great location, one of the entrances to the grand central station is opposite the entrance, its an easy walk to times sq (my wife went there everyday) and other attractions such as the empire state building and chrysler building etc.
reviews.title: Good Location but service nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the bar is expensive and the roof top bar is twice as expensive !
reviews.title: Practically Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel breakfast is a buffet and keeps you stuffed, but is again expensive so we found a nearby diner THE RED FLAME which was good with the locals as well, service was good and friendly apart from a saturday when a polish girl was on (she was just rude)
reviews.title: Surface Charm but Not Without Faults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the bar in the hotel had some nice cocktails,watch the barman though some are a bit rude, rest of new york was friendly so came as a surprise.
reviews.title: Old glamour...yeah, nice...but old...

reviews.text: rooms were ok, we were on the 3rd floor so we used the stairs as there always seemed to be a 'line' for the lifts. as we got stranded here due to the ash from iceland we had to move rooms to the 11th floor where the room was near the lifts, so all night all you could here were the lifts opening and closing and pinging.
reviews.title: Not enjoyable...actually pretty depressing

description: For a classic New York City hotel experience with the finest contemporary amenities, The Roosevelt Hotel offers 1,015 newly renovated guestrooms and suites. Opened in 1924 at the height of the Jazz Age, the "Grand Dame of Madison Avenue" continues to impress guests in its prime location in midtown Manhattan. The Roosevelt is the perfect combination of classical and modern creating a relaxing ambience in the city that never sleeps.
